title: CHANGEABLE - Specific departments are visible
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is on the Global Departments page
custom_expected:
THEN the department labels are: (this list may change)
Baseball Assistance Team
Baseball Operations
Baseball Tomorrow Fund
BOC Service Desk (frequently, BOC Service Desk does not appear in PROD)
Broadcasting
Communications
Community Affairs
Design Services
Diversity & Inclusion
Enterprise Technology
Finance
Global Marketing & Partnerships
Human Resources
Information Security
International
International Baseball Operations
Investigations
Labor Relations
Legal
MLB Executives
Office Operations
Security & Facility Management
Special Events
Youth Programs

title: Select department
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on the Global Departments page
AND the department cards have appeared
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks or taps each card
custom_expected:
THEN page redirects within the same tab to the Department Home page that matches that selected department

(Test all departments)

title: Filter departments
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on the Global Departments page
AND Filter has appeared
AND user has clicked or tapped within the Filter
custom_steps:
WHEN the user types a whole word in the Filter
OR user types a partial word
custom_expected:
THEN some Department cards disappear
AND the only boxes that remain have titles that contain the characters entered in the Filter
AND the Filter retains the characters typed

Specific test: searching for "comm" produces Communications and Community Affairs department cards.

title: Baseball Assistance Team appears
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is on the Global Departments page
custom_expected: THEN the Department card for Baseball Assistance Team is present and clickable.

title: Filter: reset
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on the Global Departments page
AND has conducted a search
AND the search reduced the number of department boxes on the page
AND the Search field has retained the characters typed
custom_steps:
WHEN user clicks or taps in the Search field
AND user deletes the characters
AND user hits Enter/Go/Return
custom_expected:
THEN all department boxes reappear
AND the boxes are aligned with each other

title: OBSOLETE - Search field appearance at and above 992px
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is on Global Departments page
custom_expected:
THEN search field appears at the top of the white box
AND it is horizontally centered
AND it contains a magnifying glass icon and Search label in gray
AND no elements overlap each other

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19207)

title: OBSOLETE - Search field appearance at and below 991px
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is on the Global Departments page
custom_expected:
THEN search field spans the box
AND its left border aligns with the left border of the Department box furthest left
AND its right border aligns with the right border of the Department box furthest right
AND it contains a magnifying glass icon and Search label in gray
AND no elements overlap each other

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19218)

title: OBSOLETE - Search field function: no departments
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on the Global Departments page
AND the Search field has appeared
custom_steps: WHEN the user searches using characters that don't appear in any department
custom_expected:
THEN all department boxes disappear
AND the white box minimizes
AND there is no message
AND the Search field retains the characters typed

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19210)

title: OBSOLETE - Grid appearance across viewports
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is on the Global Departments page
custom_expected:
THEN the boxes shrink with a decreasing viewport size
AND the boxes maintain the same amount of space between them
AND the grid changes to 2 columns or 1 column as needed to maintain the spacing
AND the labels are large enough to be easily read
AND no elements overlap any other
AND there are no empty spaces within the grid where a box should be

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19212)
![](index.php?/attachments/get/19213)
![](index.php?/attachments/get/19214)

title: OBSOLETE - Grid - no gaps
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is on the Global Departments page
custom_expected: THEN there are no gaps among the Department boxes in the grid at any viewport

title: Header appearance
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is on the Global Departments page
custom_expected:
THEN the header appears above the white box
AND it left aligns with the white box 
AND it reads: Departments
AND it is in dark blue and all caps
AND it is not linked
AND it does not overlap any element

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19206)

title: Search field function: click or tap
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on Global Departments page
AND Search field has appeared
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks or taps inside the Search field
custom_expected:
THEN a flashing vertical line appears inside the Search field
AND it is to the left of and touching the S in Search

title: Grid hover
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on the Global Departments page
AND the grid of boxes has appeared
custom_steps: WHEN user hovers cursor over any portion of any box
custom_expected: THEN cursor changes from an arrow to a pointing hand

title: Departments cards - appearance
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is on the Global Departments page
custom_expected:
THEN filter and department cards look like the photo below:

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19839)

title: Test responsiveness: no gaps in grid
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is on a desktop platform
custom_steps:
WHEN user decreases the viewport
AND WHEN user expands the viewport
custom_expected:
THEN all elements continue to appear on the page
AND no elements overlap any other in any viewport
AND images stay proportionate (not stretched or squished)
AND all elements function as expected
AND there are no gaps in the grid.

Note: In Windows IE and Edge, Blog Post images will be stretched.

title: Test mobile
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is using a mobile device
custom_expected:
THEN all elements appear on the page
AND no elements overlap any other
AND all elements function as expected
